title: Almost nothing is working.

thread.text: I can't install my apps through the play store, I can't use the home and options buttons and I can only use the return button. When I set the lock screen to swipe it goes directly to the main screen, skipping the swipe. Using a Lenovo Vibe K5. It suddenly happened when I was charging my phone.

Welcome to Android Central! Moved from the Marshmallow forum to the Lenovo Android Phones forum, since this is likely a device-specific issue, not a general Marshmallow issue.
Do the problems persist in Safe Mode? How to turn on safe mode on Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus
Yes. The problems persist.

Since it's still happening in Safe Mode, that suggests a problem with either the firmware or hardware. You could try a factory reset, but if the problem persists after that, then you'd have to try reinstalling the firmware (not sure how difficult that is on a Lenovo -- try searching the forums at XDA-developers.com, which is a good resource for that kind of thing) or bringing it to a repair shop.

title: Unable to flash lenovo a3300 custom ROMs on lenovo a3000 using twrp.

thread.text:
Hi I am Rupesh from India and I have lenovo a 3000 H tab and due to various reasons like viruses i have flashed stock rom with Android version 4.4.2 and build number: A3000H_A442_V3.0.0 and also with twrp recovery manager.
I want to install cyanogenMod on my tablet and so I visited XDA forums related to Lenovo a3000H and downloaded custom ROMS related to A3300 they are 
1) [ROM][6.0.1] Resurrection Remix v5.7.4 for A3300
2) [ROM][UNOFFICIAL][MARSHMALLOW][Lenovo A3300]CM13 for A3300
3) [ROM][GUIDE][A3300-H/HV] Cyanogen Mod 12.1 Android 5.1.1 Lenovo Tablet
In twrp recovery manager I tried to flash the above ROMS using install zip option by selecting the ROMS which are stored in external memory card of my device. Before flashing the above ROMS I have done factory reset, erased cache, DATA, System partitions in twrp recovery manager. For the above mentioned three ROMS I am getting errors such as 
1) zip verification failed
2) no data present in zip file
3) MD5 mismatch etc…
Upon getting the above errors I have re downloaded the above mentioned ROMS and tried to flash but even no use I mean I am getting same errors.
Before flashing the above mentioned ROMS I have made full system backup in twrp recovery manager to external sd card. As the system is not even unable to boot after the above failures I have made restore in twrp recovery manager.
I have tried to download the custom ROM related to A3000H but failed I mean failed to download the ROM from its download page. The ROM I tried to download from XDA forum is
[ROM][4.4.4] CyanogenMod 11.0 for A3000-H [23/10/2015]
Actually I want to use my tablet mainly to read ebooks and rarely to browse internet.Currently my tablet is not working properly so please suggest how to flash ROM called [ROM][4.4.4] CyanogenMod 11.0 for A3000-H [23/10/2015] and if not possible try to suggest how to flash custom ROM related to A3300. If none of the ROMS specified in XDA forum is not suitable for my tablet then please try to suggest any other custom ROM which is suitable to my tablet.
Regards,
Rupesh.

title: Lenovo Phab 2 is automatically switching on Mobile Data

thread.text:
I am facing an issue with PB2-650M on Android 6.0 Kernel 3.18.19+.
When on wifi, it just automatically switches on the mobile data when wifi is out of range or even when the device sleeps. I am not 100% sure, what triggers it. But I see that the "Data Connection" icon from the pull down menu is active. The only alert I see is the dialog box seen below. 
I want an option to ALWAYS disable mobile data. This device is used by my mom and she keeps accidentally touching the screen and only realizes when the credit in the phone runs out. The provider also has no option to disable data usage on the number.
This reminds me of the wifi assist feature in iphone which can be easily disabled.

Welcome to Android Central. There is a setting that turns on mobile data if wifi signal gets below a cutoff. I would look for that, but you should be able to turn mobile data off in Settings, Network (may be different on your device).

title: Save photos to SD Card

thread.text:
Hi,
I'm using Lenovo Vibe C2 and I need help how to save photos to portable SD Card. I know I can manually move that (I do that every week), but is there a way to automatically save them to SD Card? I don't see a option for that in Camera settings, and I know it's possible since I can do it, but it's annoying to move photos after taking them.
I would like help asap

Without fail, whenever I have done that in the past (configure the camera app to save photos directly to an SD card), I have inevitably had some really important photos be corrupted. Like this one, of my wife and son greeting each other at the airport upon his return from a tour of duty in Afghanistan:
So, seriously, I do not recommend this.

title: [K80m, P90] App Permissions

thread.text: Hello everybody! I bought my mom a K80m sometime ago and just yesterday she noticed that she couldn't send voice messages via WhatsApp. Turns out it says WhatsApp can't acces the microphone. I tried deleting the cache and data, updating Whatsapp, reinstalling it, nothing. I went to app permissions and it has everything enabled. Then I went to Facebook and tried to post directly from the camera. Nothing, I toched the icon but nothing would happen, not even an error. It seems that app can't access the phone's hardware, or that the apps don't have permssions enabled, but they do. Any thoughts? Thanks!
Welcome to Android Central! Some other app may be accessing the camera/microphone. Do you have a flashlight app installed? These are a common culprit.

Hi! thanks for the welcome! Unfortunately no, I don't have any flashlight or really too many apps installed. I even reseted all the app permissions to see if I could solve the problem but no luck there. It can't even make WhatsApp calls because it's not allowed to use the camera or microphone. I don't know what else to do!
Did you already try wiping the system cache partition? How to Enter Lenovo P90 Recovery Mode

I didn't, but I did factory restore it and when an app needed permissions for the first time now it asked me for them. Guess the factory reset was a more radical solution, but hey, it works for now. Thank you very much B. Diddy

title: Rambling review of the Lenovo Phab 2...

thread.text:
Realizing Lenovo Phabs are niche and wouldn't attract a lot of Androidians based on size and less than favorable reviews elswhere, I decided to check into the large phone models anyway.
I had been looking for a small LTE capable tablet that might fit into my wants/needs. 
Most devices dedicated as tablets I find are painful and uncomfortable to hold.
I thought one handing a device under the 7-8 inch range would fit the bill much better for me. 
This device is proving to be the answer.
Keeping 2 things in mind:
The Phab 2 is very large for a phone (screen@ 6.4 inches).
I paid $169.00 for it on sale from B&H Photo.
Also I'm unsure yet I don't believe the PB2 or it's counterparts will ever see Nougat from Lenovo.
With a Mediatek MT8735 processor@ 1.3 ghz and 3GB of LPDDR3 ram this device doesn't seem like it should be lighting any fires on screen obviously.
As far as backup device function the PB2 is attractive for my use with it's dual SIMs and 32GB of internal storage.
In addition for me it wins as a connected media consumption device also.
The size does make for ungainly handling in certain instances such as using as a camera in any form.
Humans the size of the Hulk may enjoy this as a pocket friendly phone. 
For most a 7 inch tall phone could be a real chore to have with you all day.
Using this as a phone is a no go for this user as this looks like the phone King Kong would use for calls.
Huge isn't all bad however.
The PB2 is very good as an armchair device or while laying back to catch up before dozing off.
The low res screen at 720p to me is still sharp enough for reading or just about anything that renders well while browsing.
YouTube's, HD video and streaming content are all pleasing from what I've seen.
Audio is fine especially with Dolby Atmos built in.
Watching Netflix or any other content using the speaker I find to be pleasing since the sound from the single speaker is full without much distortion.
The display does fall short in certain areas such as HD icons or some digital elements on screen that demand a high pixel count.
The Phab 2 is performing very well for me on T-Mobile data and Wi-Fi.
Stays connected and usually shows good signal strength in a few areas I've had problems with using other phones.
I don't use this as a phone yet I find call quality acceptable the few times I've talked on it.
The front camera on this thing can go from unusable to not bad.
Low light of course is the enemy of any smartphone camera.
Using the rear camera is a crap shoot.
Pics are anything from dismal to surprisingly good.
Again available light is probably the culprit.
I've abandoned the Lenovo camera for Snap Camera (paid)
So far Snap has proven the camera is capable of a moderately improved pic taking experience.
When it comes to features or performance of this thing which of course are crucial, I would say it's not so much the affordability or acceptable hardware that centers this phone correctly for users like myself...it's the size.
Left to right;
Lumia 925
ZTE Axon 7
Lenovo Phab 2
Thoughtful Review!
I purchased the Phab 2 Pro variant and really like it. Just wish there were more case options for it.

replies.text:
How is the the camera pic quality with your Pro version?
I like the the PB2 so much I wouldn't mind advancing to the Phab 2 Pro myself.
I'm not big on pictures so I might not be the best one to answer this. To me the camera is ok, not so good in low light.

thread.text:
@ROE_HUNTER 
Thanks...much appreciated.

I purchased this more out of curiosity and I only paid $159+tax. I set the phone up and played some music through it and noticed sound only seems to be coming from the right speaker. Are there actually two speakers on the bottom? There are two speaker grills, but sound only seems to come out of the right speaker, not the left. When you listen to audio in general, cover up the right speaker with your thumb and let me know if there is sound coming out of the left speaker. Tech Support said my phone was defective and is shipping me another one. I read somewhere else that there may in fact be only one speaker. I talked to three separate people at Lenovo and none of them ever indicated there was only one active speaker. Each person indicated 'both should work'.

replies.text:
Yep, only one speaker, but I can say that one speaker sounds better than my Nexus 6 or Moto X Pure ever did. I have the Phab
2 Pro

thread.text: It's true the Phab 2 has one speaker on the right bottom.

title: Opinions on the Lenovo Phab2 Pro

thread.text:
I think the size was big & well-fitting for the Google Tango technology. Perhaps a metaphor for big things to come?
Battery was alright, but the software didn’t seem very stable. Kinda strange considering how good I've heard their Motorola software is.
My only main gripe aside from software is how Lenovo is selling it for $500. They'd either have to lower the price in order to get me on board, or someone would have to give one to me.
What are your thoughts and opinions?

replies.text:
I have the Phab 2 Pro. I love the size, came from the Nexus 6 and I knew I wanted a larger phone. The screen is not AMOLED, but it is a very nice LCD. A lot easier to see outside than the Nexus. The battery lasts quite awhile for me. I did not buy this phone for Tango so I have only even tried one app for a few minutes. I can say this phone is definitely faster than the Nexus and every other phone I've had(Nexus 6, Moto X Pure, HTC One M8, Galaxy S3, Iphone 4). Rapid charge works great and it works with the rapid chargers I had for the Moto X Pure. Pics are OK, nothing special. I am not a big photo enthusiast so it's fine. The speaker sounds very good to me. The Dolby Atmos brings it alive. Oh! And this is the first phone I have had with a fingerprint scanner. I used to think "Why do I need a fingerprint scanner???" But now that I've had one I absolutely love it and it works flawlessly on this phone. 
A few things concern me. 
1. Audio Lag, when watching Youtube videos there is a definite audio lag. Netflix sometimes has a little lag and then sometimes its fine. I don't use my phone to watch videos that often so it hasn't bothered me as much as it probably should. Have only seen 2 others on the Lenovo forums with the same problem, no fix yet. If you turn off Dolby Atmos it gets better and sometimes fixes it for a bit. I have yet to try a factory reset, but others have with no Joy. I have not experienced any lag in games. 
2. Cases, there is a lack of cases for this phone. Basically there are 2 choices, a real thin TPU case that doesn't even have a lip to protect the screen and then a folding style case. I have the folding style case so at least there is some protection for the screen. 
3. Updates, I fear that updates will be few and far between for this phone. I will be amazed if it gets Nougat. Marshmallow runs very well on it. I have a had a couple of hiccups with different apps, but no more than any other phone. 
I am glad I purchased this phone. I love the big screen.

The problem i see is that most of it is "nothing special". When you take out Tango, it's just average in a lot of departments. Don't get me wrong, it sounds great and I'd buy one myself. But 500 dollars for something like that isn't enticing enough for me to buy it with my own money.
Though, had I gotten a Phab2 Pro one way or the other, I'd probably love it. Huge 6.4 screen and 4000+ battery is an instant attraction for me. Just don't like that price tag due to a lot of it being "nothing special", yknow? Someone would either have to gift it to me or make that $500 price way lower.
In short, I love it but not enough to spend 500.

title: Wifi in lenovo vibe k5 note

thread.text:
I'm trying to figure out how to get my lenovo k5 note to automatically connect to my wifi when I get home. I've noticed that it wont try connecting until I turn the screen on. If I'm not careful to flash the screen on briefly when I get home, my phone will stay on the cell network.
Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep: Always
Battery Saver: off
Is there another setting that I'm missing? Is it even possible to get my phone to automatically connect to a wifi network without turning the screen on?

What other options are there in the Advanced Wi-fi menu? Is there any kind of "Smart" option? (Good rule of thumb--anything from a manufacturer or carrier that is called "Smart" is typically not.)
See if this happens in Safe Mode as well: How to turn on safe mode on Lenovo K5 Note

Hi Karimla,
Normally, Mobile data should be turned off automatically by the system when WiFi is connected. If you're sure it's mobile data which is on, you could try some automation tools to handle this, e.g. Tasker (Condition: WiFi connected, Task: mobile data off).
Thanks

title: Vibe K5 2 4G chips

thread.text:
My Vibe K5 shows 2 chips as 4G & 2G. It has to show both as 4G. Does version 5.1.1 support 2 4G chips? Or may it be a company problem?
Mario.
Thanks

Welcome to Android Central! Sorry, can you clarify what the issue is? Are you saying that you have a dual SIM phone, and that one SIM card shows up as on the 4G network, but the other one is only getting 2G? If so, I believe that is normal. https://forums.lenovo.com/t5/K-and-V...s/td-p/3343000
Only SIM1 supports 4G. SIM2 can only use 2G network. Can personally confirm with K5 Plus here in Vietnam.

title: need help.....

thread.text:
I have bought a rooted Lenovo K3 Note.Yesterday,I accidentally deleted my OS.
I am stuck on boot animation.
I still have Stock recovery but I can't put my phone into USB debug mode in order to flash factory image.
Is it posseble to reinstall OS from service centre And 
How much it would cost? plz.. HELP!

Since you have no means of downloading anything to the phone (it's hardware, but you probably deleted all the firmware), you're probably going to need a JTAG service to feed the ROM back into it. Look on eBay for lenovo k3 jtag service. The cost can range from $25 to $150, depending on how greedy and how good the service is. (High price isn't an indicator of experience, nor is it an indicator of greed.)

title: How do I restore lost contacts.in Lenovo A7000 please provide good suggestions?

thread.text: Hey everyone, im using lenovo a7000 i lost my contacts from list automatically. i couldn't able to get it. any solutipn for this. how to restore those contacts..please provide good suggestions

Welcome to Android Central! Do you remember which account those contacts were saved to? If it was your Google account, then they would've automatically synced with your Google Contacts in the cloud, and should be able to sync easily back to the device. If they were saved only to the local Device Account, those don't sync or backup anywhere automatically, so you most likely lost them for good. This is why you should always strongly consider saving all of your contacts to your Google account.

title: How do I reboot my mobile?

thread.text: i am using Lenovo A5000

Assuming it didn't actually freeze while updating (just during the download, or the root/ROM check), hold the power button down until it restarts (which could take up to 30 seconds).
If it restarts into nothingness, bring it to the carrier. Their update broke your phone, so they're going to have to refalsh the update (or th whole ROM - that's their problem).
I hope you keep everything important backed up, because you might lose everything on the phone.

title: Why do my incoming calls show as unknown and the number is not displayed?

thread.text: my mobile is Lenovo A6000

Hello. 
If it was your outgoing calls not displaying to those you call, that can be changed in Settings. 
It may be your numbers in your Contacts list do not exactly tally with your callers, prefix numbers etc. 
If you have recently moved device and had contacts only saved on the sim card, many new devices apart from Samsung do not recognise sim contacts as far as I know. 
You would need to add them to Google Contacts or other. 
Go to Contacts/People - Menu - Contacts to Display.

title: I found that all my text messages are not delivering on time to the person whom I send them to. What could be the issue?

thread.text: i am a lenovo s560 user...i found that all my text messages are not deliveringon time to the person whom i send..and even i recieves all the messages exactly 4 minutes later from the send time.i also think that all my messages are been forwarded,so how can i stop all these issues?
I would contact your carrier to see if they're having issues.
And also be aware that there's no "on time" with texting. It's not considered real-time communication. If it takes 4 minutes, it takes 4 minutes. (Voice is real-time, text and email aren't.)

title: Why isn't my SD card being detected?

thread.text:
I bought a lenovo a536, i cannot transfer any files to my sd card..then my brother told that my sd card was not detected.. it still works on my old phone and can be detected in my laptop i tried to clean the pins still no go..i DL the SD insight app..it was detected by the app..my SD card is toshiba 8gb..please help
Thank you
Welcome to Android Central! Did you use SD Insight on the Lenovo phone, and it detected the card? When you go to Settings>Storage​, does it show up there as well?

hi..i use the sd insight and the card was detected, it shows up on the storage but the "unmount SD card" option is not highlighted..is there any other options that we can do in order to detect my sd card?thank you
That's unusual. In Settings>Storage, does it actually show you how much space is available on the SD?

That's unusual. In Settings>Storage, does it actually show you how much space is available on the SD? 
- yes..it also shows the total space of my sd card..then there is a pre installed file browser on my phone i can still view my old files..but the thing is, in order for me to transfer some files like games etc..i need to DL an app that allows me to transfer files right? when i tried that, the transfer to external storage is not applicable..
I don't understand why the Unmount option is greyed out. Try ES File Explorer to see if you can move the files around.

thank you for your support, i tried the ES file explorer i was able to transferred some of the files but the games i was not able to do so..i DL the app mgr III.. as i open it..it prompted a message that my cellphone does not have a real external storage. or the external storage is emulated . i have only basic games like candy crush, shadow fight etc..is there anything that we can do..

If you're trying to move apps to the external SD card, either the phone has to have that function natively, or you have to be rooted (in order to use apps like App Mgr III). You can tell if the phone has the ability to move apps to SD by going to Settings>Apps, selecting an app, and seeing if there is a Move to SD button. If there isn't, then the phone doesn't support that function (unless you root it). Even if it does have that function, you'd only be moving a small portion of the app.
thank you very much for your help..last thing..how to root my lenovo a536?will it be ok to root my phone even if its on postpaid plan?
I'm afraid I can't help you with that. Check out this thread: [Q] Root LENOVO A536? - XDA Forums

title: Are there any GMS Tools for Android Lollipop version?

thread.text:
I have Lenovo A7600-m , but I am using it in overseas where I need Google play aps and some devices, unfortunately I cannot use any Google aps in my Lenovo A7600-M,
Would you please help me to solve this issue if any solution available ?

Apps that require that you be in a certain country to work won't work if you're not in that country. You could try a VPN server in the US, but some apps look at the origin IP, not the IP the connection is coming from, so that won't fool them.

title: Why won't my phone go into recovery mode?

thread.text: My phone is Lenovo P770. I found this CPU governor app thing and there was a box and I checked it. My phone suddenly hanged and superuser thing appeared. Then I tried pressing deny and my phone just hanged. I removed the battery and tried turning it on again. It's okay starting up but after like 30 secs it just hangs... I tried going to recovery mode but it'll just light up a bit and disappear. It won't work ack! HELP PLSSSS IM SO PISSED AT MYSELF FOR BEING AN *****.

Was your phone rooted at some point? I'm asking this because you mentioned a prompt about Superuser access. Either it is the CPU governor app saying your MUST install Superuser access to use the program or your device is already rooted and it is asking to grant Superuser access. 
Either way I'm not certain as to why your device is failing to enter recovery unless you are rooted and something was corrupted w/ your stock or custom recovery.

I'm with Paul - I'm not certain either. That's something that has to be worked on hands-on to diagnose. But if it comes to the worst, find the software tool Lenovo uses to flash ROMs, find the stock ROM for your phone, and try reflashing the ROM. (Your best source for information and files is probably going to be Lenovo P780 - XDA Forums - it's for the 780, but the devs there will probably know of any differences between the two, and where you can download what you need. Also any tricks Lenovo has [every manufacturer has different little button press combinations to use to restore a soft-bricked phone].)

title: Why can't I access the phone memory when connected to pc?

thread.text: I am using lenovo S820. I got an update and upgraded my phone to kitkat 4.4.2. When I connect my phone to pc via usb cable. I cannot access the internal memory. I got this issue after upgrading. Please help

According to me ...... the memory card (SD) is actually busy with the PC and it cant be used with the phone at that time.....so.....u have the answer..................,,,,,,,,......it also happens to me on my phone with kitkat 4.4.2
I can access my sd card(memory card) from my computer when I connect it but I cannot acces my phone memory or usb memory from my pc.

When you first connect the cable to the pc, change the usb notification to MTP. 
Search for new drivers from Lenovo. 
Try a different usb port. 
Unless you are reading the sd card while still in the device, try another cable. 
Make sure Lock Screen security is set to Swipe or None.
Thanks. Now I can access my phone storage as a drive on my pc with MTP option

title: Why did my Lenovo a6000 update stop after 98?

thread.text: When i found update in my lenovo a6000 i done it 98% but after its stop and my data used almost 1 gb and 100 mb...now it is stable at 98% ....niw what should i do...plzzz help me

Welcome to Android Central! Try booting into Recovery Mode and wiping the cache partition, which won't erase any personal data. Follow the steps in this video, but instead of selecting Wipe Data/Factory Reset, make sure you select Wipe Cache Partition. When complete, then select Reboot System Now. Try updating the system again.

Welcome to Android Central! If it's a special Twitter interface provided by Lenovo, then you have to either find the exact app in Google Play Store (which isn't always available), or you have to wait for Lenovo to update the app as part of an OTA system update.

title: Why is the camera of my Lenovo S90-t refusing to come up?

thread.text: When you click on the camera, it will behave as if it is going to come up and hang with black background. When you click on the return button, it will bring out a message "Lenovo SNAPit isn't responding. Do you want to close it? with option of 'wait' and 'ok'. When you click on wait, the camera will just hang there.

Try Settings, Storage, Cached Data, and clear the cache.
Consider also the possibility that a third-party app, if you are using any, may be interfering with normal Camera function. If you can't think of a likely culprit, booting into Safe Mode would test that.
Posted via the Android Central App
